III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Policy and procedures
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12503
Section (2) The policies and procedures must cover at least all the
Description following areas:
1

(f) Amount of financial support and how it is
disbursed. An agency may not withhold financial
support intended for the youth while the youth is
actively involved in the program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency is withholding Youth A's IL stipend from her, and she is
unable to purchase food.
Investigation The allegation was made that the agency was inappropriately
withholding the independent living stipend of Youth A.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant on 9/6/2024 by telephone.
Complainant reported an alternative placement was being sought
for Youth A because she was not doing well in her current
placement and the agency was withholding Youth A's Independent
Living stipend payment.
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 11/12/2024. Youth A
reported she is still in the same placement, but she is now doing
well in the placement/program. Youth A reported she is currently
receiving her Independent Living Stipend payments, and she has
also received all of her previous payments.
I interviewed Staff 2 and Staff 3 by telephone on 11/12/2024.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 described Youth A as currently doing well in the
program/placement. Staff 2 and Staff 3 reported Youth A is
currently receiving her stipend payments and all the previous
payments that were temporarily withheld have been given to
Youth A. Staff 3 stated the agency program includes a
contract/agreement with youth participants that authorizes the
withholding of stipend payments when a youth/participant is not in
compliance with program expectations included in the
youth/participant treatment plan/goals as a means of helping
encourage progress and goal achievement. Staff 3 stated Youth
A was on "probation" until October 1, 2024, due to Youth A being
verbally abusive toward peers and staff and uncooperative in
complying with program expectations. Staff 3 stated Youth A's
stipend payments were temporarily withheld as a part of the
probation period, but Youth A was still provided food, and her
basic needs were being met during that time. Staff 3 stated Youth
A is currently off probation and doing very well.
2

Documents Reviewed:
I requested and received confirmation from Administrator 1 that
Youth A has received Youth A's Independent Living Stipend
payments and is currently continuing to receive those payments. I
received the requested documentation confirmation from
Administrator 1 on 11/15/2024. The documentation received also
included a copy of the independent living agreement/contract
signed by participants in the program to authorize the temporary
withholding for program noncompliance.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule as determined by
the interviews that were completed and the documents that were
reviewed. The interviews with staff and Youth A determined
Youth A is current in the receipt of Independent Living Stipend
payments. The contract/agreement signed by participants in this
program authorizes this temporary withholding of payments as a
means of promoting program progress and goal achievement.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff treated Youth A poorly, disrespectfully.
Investigation Allegation was made that Staff 1 treated Youth A poorly,
disrespectfully, and violated confidentiality with other staff
members and youth.
Interviews:
I interviewed Staff 3 by telephone on 11/12/2024. Staff 3
described Staff 1 as being disrespectful toward Youth A by
describing Youth A as "trifling", "dirty", "messy", and "little girl".
Staff 3 reported a meeting was conducted involving youth
participants in the program and staff members to discuss any
issues involving staff and participants. I requested information
3

related to the meetings and Staff 3 stated she would refer that
request to Administrator 1. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 is no longer
employed with the agency.
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 11/12/2024. Youth A
reported she is still in the same placement, but she is now doing
well in the placement/program. Youth A did not report any
mistreatment by Staff 1. Youth A did report Youth A had previous
conflicts/disagreements with staff and peers.
I interviewed Staff 2 by telephone on 11/12/2024. Staff 2
confirmed Youth A is currently doing well and making progress in
the program.
Attempts to interview Staff 1 were unsuccessful and voicemail
messages were not able to be completed as Staff 1's voicemail
was not set up. A text message that was received/forwarded
indicated Staff 1 did not feel supported by the agency and
voluntarily resigned.
Documents Reviewed:
I received interviews/meeting notes related to staff and participant
meetings regarding staff and youth participants
interactions/communications and relationships. The meetings
were a part of ongoing program assessments of staff and program
participants evaluations of the program functions. Comments by
some staff and some youth made during these meetings
perceived Staff 1 as showing favoritism to Youth A. The
relationship of Staff 1 with other staff members as well as program
participants was one area of discussion during these meetings.
Documentation of Staff 1's termination of employment with the
agency indicated it was a voluntary termination effective
9/10/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule as Youth A did
not indicate she was mistreated by Staff 1. Nor is it a violation of
confidentiality when information about youth is shared amongst
themselves in a program meeting.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
